019package org.jgrapes.webconsole.base;
020
021import java.io.BufferedReader;
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.io.Reader;
024import java.io.Serializable;
025import java.io.StringWriter;
026import java.net.URL;
027import java.nio.CharBuffer;
028import java.time.Duration;
029import java.time.Instant;
030import java.util.Collection;
031import java.util.Collections;
032import java.util.HashMap;
033import java.util.HashSet;
034import java.util.Iterator;
035import java.util.Locale;
036import java.util.Map;
037import java.util.Map.Entry;
038import java.util.Optional;
039import java.util.ResourceBundle;
040import java.util.Set;
041import java.util.UUID;
042import java.util.WeakHashMap;
043import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
044import java.util.concurrent.Future;
045import java.util.function.Supplier;
046import java.util.stream.Collectors;
047import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
048import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
049import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
050import org.jgrapes.core.Components.Timer;
051import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
052import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
053import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.HandlerDefinition.ChannelReplacements;
054import org.jgrapes.core.events.Detached;
055import org.jgrapes.http.Session;
056import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
057import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
058import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.Conlet.RenderMode;
059import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.AddConletRequest;
060import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.AddConletType;
061import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConletDeleted;
062import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConletResourceRequest;
063import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConsoleReady;
064import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.DeleteConlet;
065import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.NotifyConletModel;
066import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.NotifyConletView;
067import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.RemoveConletType;
068import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.RenderConlet;
069import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.RenderConletRequest;
070import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.RenderConletRequestBase;
071import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.SetLocale;
072
073/**
074 * Provides a base class for implementing web console components.
075 * The class provides the following support functions:
076 *  * "Translate" the conlet related events to invocations
077 *    of abstract methods. This is mainly a prerequisite
078 *    for implementing the other support functions.
079 *  * Optionally manage state for a conlet instance.
080 *  * Optionally track the existing previews or views of
081 *    a conlet, thus allowing the server side to send update
082 *    events (usually when the state changes on the server side).
083 *  * Optionally refresh existing previews or views periodically
084 * 
085 * # Event handling
086 * 
087 * The following diagrams show the events exchanged between
088 * the {@link WebConsole} and a web console component from the 
089 * web console component's perspective. If applicable, they also show 
090 * how the events are translated by the {@link AbstractConlet} to invocations 
091 * of the abstract methods that have to be implemented by the
092 * derived class (the web console component that provides
093 * a specific web console component type).
094 * 
095 * ## ConsoleReady
096 * 
097 * ![Add web console component type handling](AddConletTypeHandling.svg)
098 * 
099 * From the web console's page point of view, a web console component 
100 * consists of CSS and JavaScript that is added to the console page by
101 * {@link AddConletType} events and HTML that is provided by 
102 * {@link RenderConlet} events (see below). These events must 
103 * therefore be generated by a web console component. 
104 * 
105 * The {@link AbstractConlet} does not provide support for generating 
106 * an {@link AddConletType} event. The handler for the 
107 * {@link ConsoleReady} that generates this event must be implemented by
108 * the derived class itself.
109 * 
110 * ## AddConletRequest
111 * 
112 * ![Add web console component handling](AddConletHandling.svg)
113 * 
114 * The {@link AddConletRequest} indicates that a new web console component
115 * instance of a given type should be added to the page. The
116 * {@link AbstractConlet} checks the type requested, and if
117 * it matches, invokes {@link #generateInstanceId generateInstanceId}
118 * and{@link #createNewState createNewState}.
119 * If the conlet has associated state, the information is saved with
120 * {@link #putInSession putInSession}. Then 
121 * {@link #doRenderConlet doRenderConlet} is invoked, which must 
122 * render the conlet in the browser. Information about the rendered views
123 * is returned and used to track the views.
124 * 
125 * Method {@link #doRenderConlet doRenderConlet} renders the preview 
126 * or view by firing a {@link RenderConlet} event that provides to 
127 * the console session the HTML that represents the web console 
128 * component on the page. The HTML may be generated using and thus 
129 * depending on the component state.
130 * Alternatively, state independent HTML may be provided followed 
131 * by a {@link NotifyConletView} event that updates
132 * the HTML (using JavaScript) on the console page. The latter approach
133 * is preferred if the model changes frequently and updating the
134 * rendered representation is more efficient than providing a new one.
135 * 
136 * ## RenderConletRequest
137 * 
138 * ![Render web console component handling](RenderConletHandling.svg)
139 * 
140 * A {@link RenderConletRequest} event indicates that the web console page
141 * needs the HTML for displaying a web console component. This may be caused
142 * by e.g. the initial display, by a refresh or by requesting a full 
143 * page view from the preview.
144 * 
145 * Upon receiving such an event, the {@link AbstractConlet}
146 * checks if it has state information for the component id
147 * requested. If not, it calls {@link #recreateState recreateState} 
148 * which allows the conlet to e.g. retrieve state information from
149 * a backing store.
150 * 
151 * Once state information has been obtained, the method 
152 * invokes as when adding a new conlet by invoking
153 * {@link #doRenderConlet doRenderConlet}.
154 * 
155 * ## ConletDeleted
156 * 
157 * ![Web console component deleted handling](ConletDeletedHandling.svg)
158 * 
159 * When the {@link AbstractConlet} receives a {@link ConletDeleted},
160 * it updates the information about the shown conlet views. If the
161 * conlet is no longer used in the browser (no views remain),
162 * it deletes the state information from the session. In any case, it
163 * invokes {@link #doConletDeleted doConletDeleted} with the 
164 * state information.
165 * 
166 * ## NotifyConletModel
167 * 
168 * ![Notify web console component model handling](NotifyConletModelHandling.svg)
169 * 
170 * If the web console component views include input elements, actions 
171 * on these elements may result in {@link NotifyConletModel} events from
172 * the web console page to the web console. When the {@link AbstractConlet}
173 * receives such events, it retrieves any existing state information. 
174 * It then invokes {@link #doUpdateConletState doUpdateConletState} with the
175 * retrieved information. The web console component usually responds with
176 * a {@link NotifyConletView} event. However, it can also
177 * re-render the complete conlet view.
178 * 
179 * Support for unsolicited updates
180 * -------------------------------
181 * 
182 * The class tracks the relationship between the known
183 * {@link ConsoleSession}s and the web console components displayed 
184 * in these console session. The information is available from
185 * {@link #conletInfosByConsoleSession}. It can e.g. be used to send
186 * events to the web console(s) in response to an event on the server
187 * side.
188 *
189 * @param <S> the type of the conlet's state information
190 * 
191 * @startuml AddConletTypeHandling.svg
192 * hide footbox
193 * 
194 * activate WebConsole
195 * WebConsole -> Conlet: ConsoleReady
196 * deactivate WebConsole
197 * activate Conlet
198 * Conlet -> WebConsole: AddConletType 
199 * deactivate Conlet
200 * activate WebConsole
201 * deactivate WebConsole
202 * @enduml
203 * 
204 * @startuml AddConletHandling.svg
205 * hide footbox
206 * 
207 * activate WebConsole
208 * WebConsole -> Conlet: AddConletRequest
209 * deactivate WebConsole
210 * activate Conlet
211 * Conlet -> Conlet: generateInstanceId
212 * activate Conlet
213 * deactivate Conlet
214 * Conlet -> Conlet: createNewState
215 * activate Conlet
216 * deactivate Conlet
217 * opt if state
218 *     Conlet -> Conlet: putInSession
219 *     activate Conlet
220 *     deactivate Conlet
221 * end opt
222 * Conlet -> Conlet: doRenderConlet
223 * activate Conlet
224 * Conlet -> WebConsole: RenderConlet
225 * activate WebConsole
226 * deactivate WebConsole
227 * opt
228 *     Conlet -> WebConsole: NotifyConletView
229 *     activate WebConsole
230 *     deactivate WebConsole
231 * end opt
232 * deactivate Conlet
233 * Conlet -> Conlet: start conlet tracking
234 * @enduml
235 * 
236 * @startuml RenderConletHandling.svg
237 * hide footbox
238 * 
239 * activate WebConsole
240 * WebConsole -> Conlet: RenderConletRequest
241 * deactivate WebConsole
242 * activate Conlet
243 * Conlet -> Conlet: stateFromSession
244 * activate Conlet
245 * deactivate Conlet
246 * opt if not found
247 *     Conlet -> Conlet: recreateState
248 *     activate Conlet
249 *     deactivate Conlet
250 * end opt
251 * Conlet -> Conlet: doRenderConlet
252 * activate Conlet
253 * Conlet -> WebConsole: RenderConlet 
254 * activate WebConsole
255 * deactivate WebConsole
256 * opt 
257 *     Conlet -> WebConsole: NotifyConletView
258 * activate WebConsole
259 * deactivate WebConsole
260 * end opt 
261 * deactivate Conlet
262 * Conlet -> Conlet: update conlet tracking
263 * @enduml
264 * 
265 * @startuml NotifyConletModelHandling.svg
266 * hide footbox
267 * 
268 * activate WebConsole
269 * WebConsole -> Conlet: NotifyConletModel
270 * deactivate WebConsole
271 * activate Conlet
272 * Conlet -> Conlet: stateFromSession
273 * activate Conlet
274 * deactivate Conlet
275 * Conlet -> Conlet: doUpdateConletState
276 * activate Conlet
277 * opt
278 *     Conlet -> WebConsole: RenderConlet
279 * end opt 
280 * opt 
281 *     Conlet -> WebConsole: NotifyConletView
282 * end opt 
283 * deactivate Conlet
284 * deactivate Conlet
285 * @enduml
286 * 
287 * @startuml ConletDeletedHandling.svg
288 * hide footbox
289 * 
290 * activate WebConsole
291 * WebConsole -> Conlet: ConletDeleted
292 * deactivate WebConsole
293 * activate Conlet
294 * Conlet -> Conlet: stateFromSession
295 * activate Conlet
296 * deactivate Conlet
297 * alt all views deleted
298 *     Conlet -> Conlet: removeState
299 *     activate Conlet
300 *     deactivate Conlet
301 *     Conlet -> Conlet: stop conlet tracking
302 * else
303 *     Conlet -> Conlet: update conlet tracking
304 * end alt
305 * Conlet -> Conlet: doConletDeleted
306 * activate Conlet
307 * deactivate Conlet
308 * deactivate Conlet
309 * @enduml
310 */
311@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.TooManyMethods",
312    "PMD.EmptyMethodInAbstractClassShouldBeAbstract", "PMD.GodClass",
313    "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
314public abstract class AbstractConlet<S extends Serializable>
315        extends Component {
316
317    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.FieldNamingConventions",
318        "PMD.VariableNamingConventions", "PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap",
319        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
320    private static final Map<Class<?>,
321            Map<Locale, ResourceBundle>> supportedLocales
322                = Collections.synchronizedMap(new WeakHashMap<>());
323    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.FieldNamingConventions",
324        "PMD.VariableNamingConventions", "PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap" })
325    private static final Map<Class<?>,
326            Map<Locale, ResourceBundle>> l10nBundles
327                = Collections.synchronizedMap(new WeakHashMap<>());
328    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LongVariable")
329    private Map<ConsoleSession,
330            Map<String, ConletTrackingInfo>> conletInfosByConsoleSession;
331    private Duration refreshInterval;
332    private Supplier<Event<?>> refreshEventSupplier;
333    private Timer refreshTimer;
334
335    /**
336     * Creates a new component that listens for new events
337     * on the given channel.
338     * 
339     * @param channel the channel to listen on
340     */
341    public AbstractConlet(Channel channel) {
342        this(channel, null);
343    }
344
345    /**
346     * Like {@link #AbstractConlet(Channel)}, but supports
347     * the specification of channel replacements.
348     *
349     * @param channel the channel to listen on
350     * @param channelReplacements the channel replacements (see
351     * {@link Component})
352     */
353    public AbstractConlet(Channel channel,
354            ChannelReplacements channelReplacements) {
355        super(channel, channelReplacements);
356        conletInfosByConsoleSession
357            = Collections.synchronizedMap(new WeakHashMap<>());
358    }
359
360    /**
361     * If set to a value different from `null` causes an event
362     * from the given supplier to be fired on all tracked web console
363     * sessions periodically.
364     *
365     * @param interval the refresh interval
366     * @param supplier the supplier
367     * @return the web console component for easy chaining
368     */
369    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
370    public AbstractConlet<S> setPeriodicRefresh(
371            Duration interval, Supplier<Event<?>> supplier) {
372        refreshInterval = interval;
373        refreshEventSupplier = supplier;
374        if (refreshTimer != null) {
375            refreshTimer.cancel();
376            refreshTimer = null;
377        }
378        updateRefresh();
379        return this;
380    }
381
382    private void updateRefresh() {
383        if (refreshInterval == null || conletIdsByConsoleSession().isEmpty()) {
384            // At least one of the prerequisites is missing, terminate
385            if (refreshTimer != null) {
386                refreshTimer.cancel();
387                refreshTimer = null;
388            }
389            return;
390        }
391        if (refreshTimer != null) {
392            // Already running.
393            return;
394        }
395        refreshTimer = Components.schedule(tmr -> {
396            tmr.reschedule(tmr.scheduledFor().plus(refreshInterval));
397            fire(refreshEventSupplier.get(), trackedSessions());
398        }, Instant.now().plus(refreshInterval));
399    }
400
401    /**
402     * Returns the web console component type. The default implementation
403     * returns the name of the class.
404     * 
405     * @return the type
406     */
407    protected String type() {
408        return getClass().getName();
409    }
410
411    /**
412     * A default handler for resource requests. Checks that the request
413     * is directed at this web console component, and calls 
414     * {@link #doGetResource}.
415     * 
416     * @param event the resource request event
417     * @param channel the channel that the request was recived on
418     */
419    @Handler
420    public final void onConletResourceRequest(
421            ConletResourceRequest event, IOSubchannel channel) {
422        // For me?
423        if (!event.conletClass().equals(type())) {
424            return;
425        }
426        doGetResource(event, channel);
427    }
428
429    /**
430     * The default implementation searches for a file with the 
431     * requested resource URI in the web console component's class 
432     * path and sets its {@link URL} as result if found.
433     * 
434     * @param event the event. The result will be set to
435     * `true` on success
436     * @param channel the channel
437     */
438    protected void doGetResource(ConletResourceRequest event,
439            IOSubchannel channel) {
440        URL resourceUrl = this.getClass().getResource(
441            event.resourceUri().getPath());
442        if (resourceUrl == null) {
443            return;
444        }
445        event.setResult(new ResourceByUrl(event, resourceUrl));
446        event.stop();
447    }
448
449    /**
450     * Provides a resource bundle for localization.
451     * The default implementation looks up a bundle using the
452     * package name plus "l10n" as base name. Note that the bundle 
453     * returned for a given locale may be the fallback bundle.
454     * 
455     * @return the resource bundle
456     */
457    protected ResourceBundle resourceBundle(Locale locale) {
458        return ResourceBundle.getBundle(
459            getClass().getPackage().getName() + ".l10n", locale,
460            getClass().getClassLoader(),
461            ResourceBundle.Control.getNoFallbackControl(
462                ResourceBundle.Control.FORMAT_DEFAULT));
463    }
464
465    /**
466     * Returns bundles for the given locales. 
467     * 
468     * The default implementation uses {@link #resourceBundle(Locale)} 
469     * to lookup the bundles. The method is guaranteed to return a 
470     * bundle for each requested locale even if it is only the fallback 
471     * bundle. The evaluated results are cached for the conlet class.
472     *
473     * @param toGet the locales to get bundles for
474     * @return the map with locales and bundles
475     */
476    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
477    protected Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> l10nBundles(Set<Locale> toGet) {
478        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
479        Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> result = new HashMap<>();
480        for (Locale locale : toGet) {
481            ResourceBundle bundle;
482            synchronized (l10nBundles) {
483                // Due to the nested computeIfAbsent, it is not sufficient
484                // that l10nBundels is thread safe.
485                bundle = l10nBundles
486                    .computeIfAbsent(getClass(),
487                        cls -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>())
488                    .computeIfAbsent(locale, l -> resourceBundle(locale));
489            }
490            result.put(locale, bundle);
491        }
492        return Collections.unmodifiableMap(result);
493    }
494
495    /**
496     * Provides localizations for the given key for all requested locales.
497     * 
498     * The default implementation uses {@link #l10nBundles(Set)} to obtain
499     * the localizations.
500     *
501     * @param locales the requested locales
502     * @param key the key
503     * @return the result
504     */
505    protected Map<Locale, String> localizations(Set<Locale> locales,
506            String key) {
507        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
508        Map<Locale, String> result = new HashMap<>();
509        Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> bundles = l10nBundles(locales);
510        for (Map.Entry<Locale, ResourceBundle> entry : bundles.entrySet()) {
511            result.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue().getString(key));
512        }
513        return result;
514    }
515
516    /**
517     * Returns the supported locales and the associated bundles.
518     * 
519     * The default implementation invokes {@link #resourceBundle(Locale)}
520     * with all available locales and drops results with fallback bundles.
521     * The evaluated results are cached for the conlet class.
522     *
523     * @return the result
524     */
525    protected Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> supportedLocales() {
526        return supportedLocales.computeIfAbsent(getClass(), cls -> {
527            ResourceBundle.clearCache(cls.getClassLoader());
528            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
529            Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> bundles = new HashMap<>();
530            for (Locale locale : Locale.getAvailableLocales()) {
531                if ("".equals(locale.getLanguage())) {
532                    continue;
533                }
534                ResourceBundle bundle = resourceBundle(locale);
535                if (bundle.getLocale().equals(locale)) {
536                    bundles.put(locale, bundle);
537                }
538            }
539            return bundles;
540        });
541    }
542
543    /**
544     * Create the instance specific part of a conlet id. The default
545     * implementation generates a UUID. Derived classes override this
546     * method if e.g. the instance specific part must include a key that
547     * associates the conlet's state with some backing store. 
548     * 
549     * @param event the event that triggered the creation of a new conlet,
550     * which may contain required information 
551     * (see {@link AddConletRequest#properties()})
552     * @param session the console session; usually not required 
553     * but provided as context
554     *
555     * @return the web console component id
556     */
557    protected String generateInstanceId(AddConletRequest event,
558            ConsoleSession session) {
559        return UUID.randomUUID().toString();
560    }
561
562    /**
563     * Creates an instance of the type that represents the conlet's state.
564     * The default implementation returns {@link Optional#isEmpty()}, 
565     * thus indicating that no state information is needed or available.
566     *
567     * @param event the event, which may contain required information 
568     * (see {@link AddConletRequest#properties()})
569     * @param session the console session, sometimes required to
570     * send events to components that provide a backing store
571     * @param conletId the conlet id calculated as
572     * `type() + "~" + generateInstanceId(...)` 
573     * @return the state representation or {@link Optional#empty()} if none is
574     * required
575     * @throws Exception if an exception occurs
576     */
577    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException",
578        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
579    protected Optional<S> createStateRepresentation(
580            RenderConletRequestBase<?> event, ConsoleSession session,
581            String conletId) throws Exception {
582        return Optional.empty();
583    }
584
585    /**
586     * Called by {@link #onAddConletRequest}
587     * when a new conlet instance is created in the browser. The default
588     * implementation simply invokes {@link 
589     * #createStateRepresentation} and returns its result.
590     *
591     * @param event the event 
592     * @param session the console session
593     * @param conletId the conlet id
594     * @return the state representation or {@link Optional#empty()} if none is
595     * required
596     * @throws Exception if an exception occurs
597     */
598    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException",
599        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
600    protected Optional<S> createNewState(
601            AddConletRequest event, ConsoleSession session,
602            String conletId) throws Exception {
603        return createStateRepresentation(event, session, conletId);
604    }
605
606    /**
607     * Called by {@link #onRenderConletRequest} when a previously 
608     * created conlet is rendered in a new browser session
609     * for the first time. The default implementation simply invokes {@link 
610     * #createStateRepresentation} and returns its result.
611     *
612     * @param event the event 
613     * @param session the console session
614     * @param conletId the conlet id
615     * @return the state representation or {@link Optional#empty()} if none is
616     * required
617     * @throws Exception if an exception occurs
618     */
619    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException",
620        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
621    protected Optional<S> recreateState(
622            RenderConletRequest event, ConsoleSession session,
623            String conletId) throws Exception {
624        return createStateRepresentation(event, session, conletId);
625    }
626
627    /**
628     * Returns the tracked sessions and conlet ids as map.
629     * 
630     * If you need a particular session's web console component ids, you 
631     * should prefer {@link #conletIds(ConsoleSession)} over calling
632     * this method with `get(consoleSession)` appended.
633     * 
634     * @return the result
635     */
636    protected Map<ConsoleSession, Set<String>> conletIdsByConsoleSession() {
637        return conletInfosByConsoleSession.entrySet().stream()
638            .collect(Collectors.toMap(Entry::getKey,
639                e -> new HashSet<>(e.getValue().keySet())));
640    }
641
642    /**
643     * Returns the tracked sessions. This is effectively
644     * `conletInfosByConsoleSession().keySet()` converted to
645     * an array. This representation is especially useful 
646     * when the web console sessions are used as argument for 
647     * {@link #fire(Event, Channel...)}.
648     *
649     * @return the web console sessions
650     */
651    protected ConsoleSession[] trackedSessions() {
652        Set<ConsoleSession> sessions = new HashSet<>(
653            conletInfosByConsoleSession.keySet());
654        return sessions.toArray(new ConsoleSession[0]);
655    }
656
657    /**
658     * Returns the set of web console component ids associated with the 
659     * console session as a {@link Set}. If no web console components 
660     * have registered yet, an empty set is returned.
661     * 
662     * @param consoleSession the console session
663     * @return the set
664     */
665    protected Set<String> conletIds(ConsoleSession consoleSession) {
666        return new HashSet<>(conletInfosByConsoleSession.getOrDefault(
667            consoleSession, Collections.emptyMap()).keySet());
668    }
669
670    /**
671     * Returns a map of all conlet ids and the modes in which 
672     * views are currently rendered. 
673     *
674     * @param consoleSession the console session
675     * @return the map
676     */
677    protected Map<String, Set<RenderMode>>
678            conletViews(ConsoleSession consoleSession) {
679        return conletInfosByConsoleSession.getOrDefault(
680            consoleSession, Collections.emptyMap()).entrySet().stream()
681            .collect(Collectors.toMap(e -> e.getKey(),
682                e -> e.getValue().renderedAs));
683    }
684
685    /**
686     * Track the given web console component from the given session. 
687     * This is invoked by 
688     * {@link #onAddConletRequest(AddConletRequest, ConsoleSession)} and
689     * {@link #onRenderConletRequest(RenderConletRequest, ConsoleSession)}.
690     * It needs only be invoked if either method is overridden.
691     *
692     * @param consoleSession the web console session
693     * @param conletId the conlet id
694     * @param info the info to be added if currently untracked. If `null`,
695     * a new {@link ConletTrackingInfo} is created and added
696     * @return the conlet tracking info
697     */
698    protected ConletTrackingInfo trackConlet(ConsoleSession consoleSession,
699            String conletId, ConletTrackingInfo info) {
700        ConletTrackingInfo result;
701        synchronized (conletInfosByConsoleSession) {
702            Map<String, ConletTrackingInfo> infos
703                = conletInfosByConsoleSession.computeIfAbsent(consoleSession,
704                    newKey -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());
705            result = infos.computeIfAbsent(conletId,
706                key -> Optional.ofNullable(info)
707                    .orElse(new ConletTrackingInfo(conletId)));
708        }
709        updateRefresh();
710        return result;
711    }
712
713    /**
714     * Helper that provides access to a storage space for this 
715     * conlet type in the browser session.
716     *
717     * @param session the session
718     * @return the map
719     */
720    private Map<String, S> typeContext(Session session) {
721        synchronized (session) {
722            @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
723            Map<String, Map<String, S>> abstractConletContext
724                = (Map<String, Map<String, S>>) session
725                    .computeIfAbsent(AbstractConlet.class,
726                        k -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());
727            return abstractConletContext
728                .computeIfAbsent(type(), k -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());
729        }
730    }
731
732    /**
733     * Puts the given web console component state in the session using the 
734     * {@link #type()} and the given web console component id as keys.
735     * 
736     * @param session the session to use
737     * @param conletId the web console component id
738     * @param conletState the web console component state
739     * @return the component state
740     */
741    protected Serializable putInSession(Session session, String conletId,
742            S conletState) {
743        typeContext(session).put(conletId, conletState);
744        return conletState;
745    }
746
747    /**
748     * Returns the state of this web console component's type 
749     * with the given id from the session.
750     *
751     * @param session the session to use
752     * @param conletId the web console component id
753     * @return the web console component state
754     */
755    protected Optional<S> stateFromSession(Session session, String conletId) {
756        return Optional.ofNullable(typeContext(session).get(conletId));
757    }
758
759    /**
760     * Returns all conlet ids and conlet states of this web console 
761     * component's type from the session.
762     *
763     * @param session the console session
764     * @return the states
765     */
766    protected Collection<Map.Entry<String, S>>
767            statesFromSession(ConsoleSession session) {
768        return typeContext(session.browserSession()).entrySet();
769    }
770
771    /**
772     * Removes the web console component state of the 
773     * web console component with the given id from the session. 
774     * 
775     * @param session the session to use
776     * @param conletId the web console component id
777     * @return the removed state if state existed
778     */
779    protected Optional<S> removeState(Session session, String conletId) {
780        S state = typeContext(session).remove(conletId);
781        return Optional.ofNullable(state);
782    }
783
784    /**
785     * Checks if the request applies to this component. If so, stops the event,
786     * creates a new conlet id (see {@link #generateInstanceId}) and 
787     * new state information (see {@link #createNewState}). The state
788     * is saved in the session (see {@link #putInSession}),
789     * {@link #doRenderConlet} is called and its result is passed to
790     * {@link #trackConlet}.
791     *
792     * @param event the event
793     * @param consoleSession the channel
794     * @throws Exception the exception
795     */
796    @Handler
797    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException",
798        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
799    public final void onAddConletRequest(AddConletRequest event,
800            ConsoleSession consoleSession) throws Exception {
801        if (!event.conletType().equals(type())) {
802            return;
803        }
804        event.stop();
805        String conletId
806            = type() + "~" + generateInstanceId(event, consoleSession);
807        Optional<S> state = createNewState(event, consoleSession, conletId);
808        state.ifPresent(s -> putInSession(
809            consoleSession.browserSession(), conletId, s));
810        event.setResult(conletId);
811        trackConlet(consoleSession, conletId, new ConletTrackingInfo(conletId)
812            .addModes(doRenderConlet(event, consoleSession, conletId,
813                state.orElse(null))));
814    }
815
816    /**
817     * Checks if the request applies to this component. If so, stops 
818     * the event. If the conlet is completely removed from the browser,
819     * removes the web console component state from the 
820     * browser session. In all cases, it calls {@link #doConletDeleted} 
821     * with the state.
822     * 
823     * @param event the event
824     * @param consoleSession the web console session
825     * @throws Exception the exception
826     */
827    @Handler
828    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
829    public final void onConletDeleted(ConletDeleted event,
830            ConsoleSession consoleSession) throws Exception {
831        if (!event.conletId().startsWith(type() + "~")) {
832            return;
833        }
834        String conletId = event.conletId();
835        Optional<S> model = stateFromSession(
836            consoleSession.browserSession(), conletId);
837        if (event.renderModes().isEmpty()) {
838            removeState(consoleSession.browserSession(), conletId);
839            for (Iterator<Entry<ConsoleSession, Map<String,
840                    ConletTrackingInfo>>> csi = conletInfosByConsoleSession
841                        .entrySet().iterator();
842                    csi.hasNext();) {
843                Map<String, ConletTrackingInfo> infos = csi.next().getValue();
844                infos.remove(conletId);
845                if (infos.isEmpty()) {
846                    csi.remove();
847                }
848            }
849            updateRefresh();
850        } else {
851            trackConlet(consoleSession, conletId, null)
852                .removeModes(event.renderModes());
853        }
854        event.stop();
855        doConletDeleted(event, consoleSession, event.conletId(),
856            model.orElse(null));
857    }
858
859    /**
860     * Called by {@link #onConletDeleted} to propagate the event to derived
861     * classes.
862     *
863     * @param event the event
864     * @param channel the channel
865     * @param conletId the web console component id
866     * @param conletState the conlet's state; may be `null` if the
867     * conlet doesn't have associated state information
868     * @throws Exception if a problem occurs
869     */
870    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
871    protected void doConletDeleted(ConletDeleted event, ConsoleSession channel,
872            String conletId, S conletState)
873            throws Exception {
874        // May be defined by derived class.
875    }
876
877    /**
878     * Checks if the request applies to this component by verifying 
879     * if the component id starts with {@link #type()} plus "~".
880     * If the id matches, sets the event's result to `true`, stops the 
881     * event and tries to retrieve the model from the session. If this
882     * fails, {@link #recreateState} is called as another attempt to
883     * obtain state information.
884     *  
885     * Finally, {@link #doRenderConlet} is called and the result is added
886     * to the tracking information. 
887     *
888     * @param event the event
889     * @param consoleSession the web console session
890     * @throws Exception the exception
891     */
892    @Handler
893    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
894    public final void onRenderConletRequest(RenderConletRequest event,
895            ConsoleSession consoleSession) throws Exception {
896        if (!event.conletId().startsWith(type() + "~")) {
897            return;
898        }
899        Optional<S> state = stateFromSession(
900            consoleSession.browserSession(), event.conletId());
901        if (state.isEmpty()) {
902            state = recreateState(event, consoleSession, event.conletId());
903        }
904        event.setResult(true);
905        event.stop();
906        Set<RenderMode> rendered = doRenderConlet(
907            event, consoleSession, event.conletId(), state.orElse(null));
908        trackConlet(consoleSession, event.conletId(), null).addModes(rendered);
909    }
910
911    /**
912     * Called by 
913     * {@link #onAddConletRequest(AddConletRequest, ConsoleSession)} and
914     * {@link #onRenderConletRequest(RenderConletRequest, ConsoleSession)} 
915     * to complete rendering the web console component.
916     * 
917     * The 
918     *
919     * @param event the event
920     * @param channel the channel
921     * @param conletId the component id
922     * @param conletState the conlet's state; may be `null` if the
923     * conlet doesn't have associated state information
924     * @return the rendered modes
925     * @throws Exception the exception
926     */
927    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
928    protected abstract Set<RenderMode> doRenderConlet(
929            RenderConletRequestBase<?> event, ConsoleSession channel,
930            String conletId, S conletState)
931            throws Exception;
932
933    /**
934     * Invokes {@link #doSetLocale(SetLocale, ConsoleSession, String)}
935     * for each web console component in the console session.
936     * 
937     * If the vent has the reload flag set, does nothing.
938     * 
939     * The default implementation fires a 
940     *
941     * @param event the event
942     * @param consoleSession the web console session
943     * @throws Exception the exception
944     */
945    @Handler
946    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
947    public void onSetLocale(SetLocale event, ConsoleSession consoleSession)
948            throws Exception {
949        if (event.reload()) {
950            return;
951        }
952        for (String conletId : conletIds(consoleSession)) {
953            if (!doSetLocale(event, consoleSession, conletId)) {
954                event.forceReload();
955                break;
956            }
957        }
958    }
959
960    /**
961     * Called by {@link #onSetLocale(SetLocale, ConsoleSession)} for
962     * each web console component in the console session. Derived 
963     * classes must send events for updating the representation to 
964     * match the new locale.
965     * 
966     * If the method returns `false` this indicates that the representation 
967     * cannot be updated without reloading the web console page.
968     * 
969     * The default implementation fires a {@link RenderConletRequest}
970     * with tracked render modes (one of or both {@link RenderMode#Preview}
971     * and {@link RenderMode#View}), thus updating the known representations.
972     * (Assuming that "Edit" and "Help" modes are represented with modal 
973     * dialogs and therefore locale changes aren't possible while these are 
974     * open.) 
975     *
976     * @param event the event
977     * @param channel the channel
978     * @param conletId the web console component id
979     * @return true, if the locale could be changed
980     * @throws Exception the exception
981     */
982    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
983    protected boolean doSetLocale(SetLocale event, ConsoleSession channel,
984            String conletId) throws Exception {
985        fire(new RenderConletRequest(event.renderSupport(), conletId,
986            trackConlet(channel, conletId, null).renderedAs()),
987            channel);
988        return true;
989    }
990
991    /**
992     * If {@link #stateFromSession(Session, String)} returns a model,
993     * calls {@link #doUpdateConletState} with the model. 
994     *
995     * @param event the event
996     * @param channel the channel
997     * @throws Exception the exception
998     */
999    @Handler
1000    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
1001    public final void onNotifyConletModel(NotifyConletModel event,
1002            ConsoleSession channel) throws Exception {
1003        if (!event.conletId().startsWith(type() + "~")) {
1004            return;
1005        }
1006        Optional<S> model
1007            = stateFromSession(channel.browserSession(), event.conletId());
1008        doUpdateConletState(event, channel, model.orElse(null));
1009    }
1010
1011    /**
1012     * Called by {@link #onNotifyConletModel} to complete handling
1013     * the notification. The default implementation does nothing.
1014     * 
1015     * @param event the event
1016     * @param channel the channel
1017     * @param conletState the conlet's state; may be `null` if the
1018     * conlet doesn't have associated state information
1019     */
1020    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SignatureDeclareThrowsException")
1021    protected void doUpdateConletState(NotifyConletModel event,
1022            ConsoleSession channel, S conletState) throws Exception {
1023        // Default is to do nothing.
1024    }
1025
1026    /**
1027     * Removes the {@link ConsoleSession} from the set of tracked sessions.
1028     * If derived web console components need to perform extra actions when a
1029     * console session is closed, they have to override 
1030     * {@link #afterOnClosed(Closed, ConsoleSession)}.
1031     * 
1032     * @param event the closed event
1033     * @param consoleSession the web console session
1034     */
1035    @Handler
1036    public final void onClosed(Closed event, ConsoleSession consoleSession) {
1037        conletInfosByConsoleSession.remove(consoleSession);
1038        updateRefresh();
1039        afterOnClosed(event, consoleSession);
1040    }
1041
1042    /**
1043     * Invoked by {@link #onClosed(Closed, ConsoleSession)} after
1044     * the web console session has been removed from the set of
1045     * tracked sessions. The default implementation does
1046     * nothing.
1047     * 
1048     * @param event the closed event
1049     * @param consoleSession the web console session
1050     */
1051    protected void afterOnClosed(Closed event, ConsoleSession consoleSession) {
1052        // Default is to do nothing.
1053    }
1054
1055    /**
1056     * Calls {@link #doRemoveConletType()} if this component
1057     * is detached.
1058     *
1059     * @param event the event
1060     */
1061    @Handler
1062    public void onDetached(Detached event) {
1063        if (!equals(event.node())) {
1064            return;
1065        }
1066        doRemoveConletType();
1067    }
1068
1069    /**
1070     * Iterates over all sessions and fires {@link DeleteConlet}
1071     * events for all known conlets and a {@link RemoveConletType} 
1072     * event.
1073     */
1074    protected void doRemoveConletType() {
1075        conletIdsByConsoleSession().forEach((session, conletIds) -> {
1076            conletIds.forEach(conletId -> {
1077                session.respond(
1078                    new DeleteConlet(conletId, RenderMode.basicModes));
1079            });
1080            session.respond(new RemoveConletType(type()));
1081        });
1082    }
1083
1084    /**
1085     * The information tracked about web console components that are
1086     * used by the console. It includes the component's id and the
1087     * currently rendered views (only preview and view are tracked,
1088     * with "deletable preview" mapped to "preview").
1089     */
1090    protected static class ConletTrackingInfo {
1091        private final String conletId;
1092        private final Set<RenderMode> renderedAs;
1093
1094        /**
1095         * Instantiates a new conlet tracking info.
1096         *
1097         * @param conletId the conlet id
1098         */
1099        public ConletTrackingInfo(String conletId) {
1100            this.conletId = conletId;
1101            renderedAs = new HashSet<>();
1102        }
1103
1104        /**
1105         * Returns the conlet id.
1106         *
1107         * @return the id
1108         */
1109        public String conletId() {
1110            return conletId;
1111        }
1112
1113        /**
1114         * The render modes current used.
1115         *
1116         * @return the render modes
1117         */
1118        public Set<RenderMode> renderedAs() {
1119            return renderedAs;
1120        }
1121
1122        /**
1123         * Adds the given modes.
1124         *
1125         * @param modes the modes
1126         * @return the conlet tracking info
1127         */
1128        public ConletTrackingInfo addModes(Set<RenderMode> modes) {
1129            if (modes.contains(RenderMode.Preview)) {
1130                renderedAs.add(RenderMode.Preview);
1131            }
1132            if (modes.contains(RenderMode.View)) {
1133                renderedAs.add(RenderMode.View);
1134            }
1135            return this;
1136        }
1137
1138        /**
1139         * Removes the given modes.
1140         *
1141         * @param modes the modes
1142         * @return the conlet tracking info
1143         */
1144        public ConletTrackingInfo removeModes(Set<RenderMode> modes) {
1145            renderedAs.removeAll(modes);
1146            return this;
1147        }
1148
1149        @Override
1150        public int hashCode() {
1151            return conletId.hashCode();
1152        }
1153
1154        @Override
1155        public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1156            if (this == obj) {
1157                return true;
1158            }
1159            if (obj == null) {
1160                return false;
1161            }
1162            if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
1163                return false;
1164            }
1165            ConletTrackingInfo other = (ConletTrackingInfo) obj;
1166            if (conletId == null) {
1167                if (other.conletId != null) {
1168                    return false;
1169                }
1170            } else if (!conletId.equals(other.conletId)) {
1171                return false;
1172            }
1173            return true;
1174        }
1175    }
1176
1177    /**
1178     * Send to the web console page for adding or updating a complete web 
1179     * console component representation.
1180     */
1181    public static class RenderConletFromReader extends RenderConlet {
1182
1183        private final Future<String> content;
1184
1185        /**
1186         * Creates a new event.
1187         *
1188         * @param request the request
1189         * @param conletType the conlet type
1190         * @param conletId the id of the web console component
1191         * @param contentReader the content reader
1192         */
1193        public RenderConletFromReader(RenderConletRequestBase<?> request,
1194                String conletType, String conletId, Reader contentReader) {
1195            super(conletType, conletId);
1196            // Start to prepare the content immediately and concurrently.
1197            content = request.processedBy().map(pby -> pby.executorService())
1198                .orElse(Components.defaultExecutorService()).submit(() -> {
1199                    StringWriter content = new StringWriter();
1200                    CharBuffer buffer = CharBuffer.allocate(8192);
1201                    try (Reader rdr = new BufferedReader(contentReader)) {
1202                        while (true) {
1203                            if (rdr.read(buffer) < 0) {
1204                                break;
1205                            }
1206                            buffer.flip();
1207                            content.append(buffer);
1208                            buffer.clear();
1209                        }
1210                    } catch (IOException e) {
1211                        throw new IllegalStateException(e);
1212                    }
1213                    return content.toString();
1214                });
1215
1216        }
1217
1218        /**
1219         * Content.
1220         *
1221         * @return the future
1222         */
1223        @Override
1224        public Future<String> content() {
1225            return content;
1226        }
1227    }
1228}
